answerText: Hedda Gabler[10] Hedda Gabler was written by this playwright. In his play A Doll's House, Nora Helmer decides not to commit suicide when her narcissistic husband Torvald discovers that she once forged her father's signature on a bond.
heading: Michigan Fall Tournament |2013 | 1 | 15 | Literature | European | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: In this play, EilertLovborg determines not to contest George Tesman for a professorship, content instead to work on the manuscript of his life's masterwork. For 10 points each: [10] Name this play whose title character commits suicide after destroying Lovborg's manuscript and then convincing Lovborg to kill himself.
